Module com.example.fitnesscompany
Package client

Class GymManagerController

java.lang.Object
client.GymManagerController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class GymManagerController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The Controller class responsible for the "control" of the application contains FXML injections and control node functionalities Implements Initializable for initializing class fields and fxml elements

    Database used to store all classes along with the schedule declared here as a private field for convince

    private javafx.scene.control.ChoiceBox<FitnessClass>
    fc_fitnessClassText
    ChoiceBox/Dropdown List to input the FitnessClass the member is trying to check into, all FitnessClasses are added when the user loads the schedule with loadSchedule()

    TextField to input the last name of a member

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    add(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This function will be called when the "Add" button on the Membership tab is clicked adds a member to the member database
    void
    checkIn()
    This function will be called when the "Check In" button on the Fitness Class tab is clicked checks-in a member to a class
    void
    checkOut()
    This function will be called when the "Check Out" button on the Fitness Class tab is clicked drops/checks-out a member from a class
    void
    displaySchedule()
    Displays all classes and their schedules, called when the "Show all classes" MenuItem is clicked
    void
    initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
    Inherited method of the Initializable interface, this is used to initialize our field as well as some FXML elements
    void
    isScheduleEmpty()
    This is to make sure that the user loads the class schedule before trying to check-in or check-out a member.
    void
    loadMembers()
    This is used to load all the members from a file to the current member database, called when the "Load member list from file" MenuItem is clicked
    void
    loadSchedule()
    This is used to load all the fitness classes from a file to the current class database, called when the "Load class schedule from file" MenuItem is clicked
    static void
    log(String message)
    Since this is the main client controller class, it will also be responsible for logging messages to our console such as helpful info as well as errors/warnings, these can also be toggled with a boolean variable like boolean debug = true;
    static void
    logf(String format, Object... args)
    Logs a message on the console with formatting
    void
    print()
    print the memberdatabase contents as is, called when the "Print" MenuItem is clicked
    void
    printByCounty()
    print the memberdatabase contents sorted by county and then zipcode, called when the "Print by County/Zipcode" MenuItem is clicked
    void
    printByExpirationDate()
    print the memberdatabase contents sorted by the expiration date called when the "Print by Expiration Date" MenuItem is clicked
    void
    printByName()
    print the memberdatabase contents sorted by last name and then first name called when the "Print by Last/First Names" MenuItem is clicked
    void
    printWithMembershipFees()
    print the memberdatabase contents sorted by the membership fees.
    void
    remove(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    removes a member from the member database, called when the "Remove" button is clicked
    void
    setConsole(javafx.scene.control.TextArea textArea)
    When the controller is created, this method needs to be called to create our custom console which is a static textArea field so it could be accessed anywhere

    • isScheduleEmpty

      public void isScheduleEmpty()
      This is to make sure that the user loads the class schedule before trying to check-in or check-out a member. Opens an alert that will automatically loads the schedule if the users agrees

    • setConsole

      public void setConsole(javafx.scene.control.TextArea textArea)
      When the controller is created, this method needs to be called to create our custom console which is a static textArea field so it could be accessed anywhere
      Parameters:
      textArea -

    • log

      public static void log(String message)
      Since this is the main client controller class, it will also be responsible for logging messages to our console such as helpful info as well as errors/warnings, these can also be toggled with a boolean variable like boolean debug = true;
      Parameters:
      message - the message to be logged

    • logf

      public static void logf(String format, Object... args)
      Logs a message on the console with formatting
      Parameters:
      format - a format string of the message to be logged
      args - arguments for the format string
